adviseScripts.text: Hey. You know bubble gum?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: What is your favorite flavor?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Peach.
Ginseng.
Epinel gives you a thumbs up.
Neat choice, Coach.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Just exactly how old are you, Coach?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I discuss bubble gum preferences with Epinel.

My hair is too long.
It's hard to dry after I take a shower.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Got any tips?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Get an industrial-strength hair dryer.
Come to my office. I can help you.

Industrial-strength...
The kind the barbers use?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I'll... uh... try to find one, I guess.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: OK, then. Tomorrow morning I'm showing up with towels and a hair dryer.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: You can't complain, either. It was your idea.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I listen to Epinel's troubles.
Coach, give it to me straight.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Am I... short?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Not at all.
The shorter, the cuter!
Yeah, right?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: My size never gets in the way when I'm working out, anyway.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Uh...
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Yeah. Cool. Thanks.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I listen to all of Epinel's troubles.
Coach, do you ever get tired of being a Commander?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: All the time.
Never.
Oh. I thought you wouldn't.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text:
Well, anyway,
that makes me feel a little less alone.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I thought I was the only one who ever felt that way.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Whoa.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: You're a real tough guy.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I listen to Epinel's various troubles.
Coach, you free tomorrow?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I have a big competition tomorrow at Nepenthe.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I'm busy.
I'll be there. I promise.
Huh. I get it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Work always comes first for the Coach.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: ... Thank you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: If Coach is really there, I'll definitely give it my best.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I have a meaningful conversation with Epinel.
What was it like to skateboard on the surface back in the day?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I wanna know what skateboarders were like back then.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Free as a bird.
No different from skateboarding in the Ark.
Hah. I knew it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: That's why I keep fighting harder, day after day.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text:
I need to win back the place where I can skateboard,
free as a bird.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Huh.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Coach could be happy anywhere, I guess.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I have a meaningful conversation with Epinel.
Coach, when we're done here, wanna come skateboard with me?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: There's a park by the gym.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Sure.
Sorry, I'm just too busy.
Cool.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text:
It's got stairs with railings and benches.
Perfect place for skateboarding.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Even better, nobody ever goes there. We can play until lights out.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Whatever. I get it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I have a meaningful conversation with Epinel.
Rumani is always bossing me around and telling me what to eat.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text:
She says I can't have any carbs...
and I have to take protein Splendamin four times a day.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: That sounds like workplace bullying.
Do what she says. It's good advice.
I know, right?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I'll tell her off next time.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Coach...
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Well, I guess I walked right into that one.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I talk with Epinel about her squad members.
My fans always copy everything I do. It's such a drag.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text:
I know they're just kids,
but they need to learn to think for themselves, right?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Teenagers only copy the coolest people.
Kids these days just don't know how to act.

Whatever.
If you say so.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I really don't think it's a recent problem.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: From what I remember, kids have been like that since I debuted as a skateboarder.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I have a meaningful conversation with Epinel.
Coach, have you ever... liked someone?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Nope.
I'm still waiting.
Wha? Really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: And with so many cool Nikkes around you...
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: You're really cold, Coach.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Waiting? For what?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Hold on, you mean you still haven't met your special someone?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Well, good luck with that, Coach...
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I have a cozy chat with Epinel.
I feel like I've been stuck in a rut.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: What do you usually do to pull yourself back up on your feet?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I face the problem head on until I overcome it.
I just wait and have faith that everything will work out in the end.
I see...
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Right... it's better to take action
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: instead of sitting around waiting for the problem to solve itself.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I see...
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: But doesn't that make you more anxious?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Just waiting around without knowing when everything will be resolved?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Epinel and I talk more about feeling stuck in a rut.
I always carry bubble gum with me in my pocket.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: What do you normally carry in your pockets?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Some candy or gum.
Money.
I actually get bored talking to you sometimes.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: We're too similar.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: How about I trade you some of my gum for your candy?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Yep, you're an adult all right. Not a fun-loving bone in your body.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: During our discussion, Epinel and I show each other the contents of our pockets.
If we ever end up reclaiming the surface,
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: what's the first thing you would do?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Experience my first moment of freedom skateboarding with you up on the surface.
Since the fight would finally be over, I'd enjoy some long overdue R&R.
Nice!
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: You'll probably know your way around a board by then.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I hope that day comes sooner rather than later.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Right... you're always being put through the wringer.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I'll kick back and relax too, then.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: But you have to promise to go skateboarding with me once you're finished resting, okay?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Epinel and I spend more time imaging our plans for the future.
Hey, check it out! I invented a new trick.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: What do you think I should call it?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: First off, what's the trick?
Triple kickflip nollie shuvit.
Oh right, I forgot to tell you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Good thing you reminded me!
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: It's nothing too crazy, just a basic trick.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: It's a brilliant name,
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: but I don't think it really goes well with the trick.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Now that I think about it, I never told you what the trick was!
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Epinel and I try to come up with a good name for her new skateboarding trick.
I've been thinking about buying a new skateboard to practice on.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Should I buy one that's nice and simple, or one that's all tricked out?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: They're both the same brand.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: One that's simple.
One that's tricked out.
You think so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I always ride the same type of skateboard,
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: so I was thinking about buying something different to practice on.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: But then again, something simple should get the job done.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I'm worried that it might be a little too much for me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Still, I always ride the same type of skateboard, so
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: it might be okay if I'm just using it to practice on.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I try to guide Epinel through her conundrum over the design of her skateboard.
People expect a lot from me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I want to live up to those high expectations, so I always push things to the limit.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: That mindset is what got you to where you are today.
Just be careful. You might end up hurting yourself one day.
... Thank you for saying that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: You're right, it's that very mindset that
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: got me this far.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: My only worry is that I'll fall into another slump
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: if I take my foot off the gas for even an instant.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Epinel and I have a serious conversation.
I'd like to go head to head with Sugar. My skateboard versus her motorcycle.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I know full well she'll smoke me, but I think it'd be fun, don't you?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I think if you put your mind to it, you might win.
It'll be a race for the ages.
Thank you for saying that,
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: but I still don't see it happening.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: How can a skateboard edge out a motorcycle?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: You think so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Maybe I'll make it an exhibition match in the next competition.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: You have to come to watch, Coach.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Epinel and I imagine what it would be like for her to race against Sugar.
Coach, I need something right away. Can you guess what it is?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Shoes.
skateboard.
I knew you'd figure it out.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I tore up my shoes again during practice.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I'm gonna go buy a pair later, want to come with me?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Nope. Fortunately, my skateboard is fine.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I did, however, ruin another pair of shoes during practice.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I'll have to buy another pair later.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Epinel and I talk about what new shoes she'll buy.
I can be pouring sweat, but as soon as I'm on my skateboard, all the wind dries the sweat off.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: You think I should tell Folkwang to give skateboarding a try?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I think it's a great idea.
I don't think that's a good idea.
Perfect. I'll have her swing by during one of my practice sessions.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: She'll probably end up sweating up a storm and quitting.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: But you never know.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Yeah, it would take a while to teach her.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Not only that, she'd have to be motivated to do it as well.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Oh well, it was a nice thought.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Epinel and I discuss whether or not skateboarding will help Folkwang with her excessive perspiration.
The more people there are that get into skateboarding,
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: the more injuries start piling up.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: You think there's any way to counteract that problem?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Have everyone wear safety gear.
Limit the purchase of skateboards.
That's a good idea.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: If you're padded up, the chances of you injuring yourself go way down.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I'll slap on some safety gear for a while too.
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Are you sure that won't make skateboarding too inaccessible?
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I don't want to cut people off from the sport entirely,
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: I just want them to be able to ride safely...
adviseScripts.speaker: Epinel

adviseScripts.text: Epinel and I talked more about skateboarding safety.
